member.summary: Command handler for the Paste command.

member.name: M:ILOG.Diagrammer.Design.RootDesigner.OnMenuPasteStatus(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is a speical callback command that is used to update the status of the Paste command. Normally changing the status of a command is done by us in response to some sort of change. For example, Cut, Copy and Delete are all enabled whenever there is a non-zero selection and the base Grapher object isn't selected. Paste is special, however, because enabling it is based solely on the contents of the clipboard. We have defined another class below called ImmediateMenuCommand. This class derives from MenuCommand and has an additional event handler that is called whenever Visual Studio wants to know the status of a command. Here we check the data type on the clipboard to see if it supports our format.

member.name: M:ILOG.Diagrammer.Design.RootDesigner.OnLoadComplete(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for the load complete event. We listen to this event so that after the shape designer is loaded we can add a toolbox item to the toolbox. We must wait until after the load completes because the fully qualified name of the base class is not known until that time.

member.name: M:ILOG.Diagrammer.Design.RootDesigner.System#ComponentModel#Design#IRootDesigner#GetView(System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology)
member.summary: Our implementation of IRootDesigner.GetView. This expects a windows forms view technogy. Our view is just a Windows Forms control that has a paint handler that knows how to draw shapes.

member.name: M:ILOG.Diagrammer.Design.RootDesigner.System#Drawing#Design#IToolboxUser#GetToolSupported(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem)
member.summary: Our implementation of IToolboxUser.GetToolSupported. This method is actually never called. In order for this method to be called, we must have specified a ToolboxItemFilterType of Custom. Our filtering needs are very simple so we don't need to do that. Custom filter types should be used with caution because they can impact the performance of your designer.

member.name: M:ILOG.Diagrammer.Design.RootDesigner.System#Drawing#Design#IToolboxUser#ToolPicked(System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem)
member.summary: Our implementation of IToolboxUser.ToolPicked. This is called by the toolbox service when the user double clicks on a toolbox item. The item we get has already passed the filter test so we don't need to do any additional checks. Toolbox items know how to create their own components, so creating a new shape here is really easy.

member.name: T:ILOG.Diagrammer.Design.DiagramDesignSurface
member.summary: A control that allows editing of a object using the component model.
member.remarks:
The implements the Windows Forms component model. It displays a in which graphic objects are hosted in the component model. The main services implemented by the component model are:
UndoRedoEngine
ISelectionService
IMenuCommandService
IComponentChangeService
INameCreationService
IServiceContainer
Use the method to get a reference to one of those services. Use the property to get the object being edited.
To add or remove objects from the design surface, use the following methods: , .
You can also use the static methods of the class to modify the design surface.
